name: Vegan Empanadas filled with Mushrooms in Mole
description: These vegan empanadas are filled with mushrooms sauteed until golden brown and simmered in a mole poblano.
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup Aquafaba (liquid from a can of chickpeas)

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 cup of vegetable stock in a medium sauce pot. Add the jar of Hernan mole paste. Bring to a simmer and stir to dissolve the paste. Once the paste dissolves and starts to thicken, add 1 more cup of vegetable stock. Set aside
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 cup of vegetable stock in a medium sauce pot. Add the jar of Hernan mole paste. Bring to a simmer and stir to dissolve the paste. Once the paste dissolves and starts to thicken, add 1 more cup of vegetable stock. Set aside

itemListElement.text: The sauce thickens as it cools, so if it gets too thick add a little more vegetable stock to thin it out.
itemListElement.name: The sauce thickens as it cools, so if it gets too thick add a little more vegetable stock to thin it out.

itemListElement.text: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and add 1 tbsp. of oil (or ¼ cup of water) and sauté mushrooms until golden brown, about 6-8 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and add 1 tbsp. of oil (or ¼ cup of water) and sauté mushrooms until golden brown, about 6-8 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Add onions to the pan and continue to cook until onions are tender and translucent, about 4-5 min. If the onions and mushrooms begin to stick, add a little bit of vegetable stock to the pan.
itemListElement.name: Add onions to the pan and continue to cook until onions are tender and translucent, about 4-5 min. If the onions and mushrooms begin to stick, add a little bit of vegetable stock to the pan.

itemListElement.text: Pour in 1 cup of mole sauce, and stir to combine. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Pour in 1 cup of mole sauce, and stir to combine. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Sift whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, masa harina, baking powder, and salt into a large bowl.
itemListElement.name: Sift whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, masa harina, baking powder, and salt into a large bowl.

itemListElement.text: Make a well in the center. Add water and olive oil.
itemListElement.name: Make a well in the center. Add water and olive oil.

itemListElement.text: Sprinkle flour on your work surface, divide dough into 12 equal balls. Roll out one ball to 3-inch wide circle.
itemListElement.name: Sprinkle flour on your work surface, divide dough into 12 equal balls. Roll out one ball to 3-inch wide circle.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 tbsp. of filling to the empanada disk and fold the dough over in half to enclose the filling. Use a fork to press and seal the edges closed. Repeat with the rest of the 11 balls. You can refrigerate the uncooked empanadas for up to 3 hours.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 tbsp. of filling to the empanada disk and fold the dough over in half to enclose the filling. Use a fork to press and seal the edges closed. Repeat with the rest of the 11 balls. You can refrigerate the uncooked empanadas for up to 3 hours.

itemListElement.text: Bake 20 min. at 375F or until golden brown.
itemListElement.name: Bake 20 min. at 375F or until golden brown.
